page.title: 09ALL ABOUT THIS AREA
page.content: The countryside is hilly sloping up from the Solway Firth and is mostly farmland with quite a lot of woods.We have a river called the Kirtle.We live near the A74 in the village ofKirkpatrick-Fleming.The school inext to a railway line. There are no towns in our area but there are 15 farms. The main railway line from London to Glasgow runs through our village beside the A74. Most people in Kirkpatrick-Fleming work as farmers because in this area there aren't as many jobs as in a town. Most people live in farmhouses because our dads are farmers. Some people live in cottages or council houses in the village.
